review: neva is pure visual and musical therapy the art is absolutely stunning every frame feels like a living painting and the soundtrack is so beautiful it stays in your mind long after you finish the story is heartfelt and engaging and despite the games simplicity its incredibly fun and satisfying to play a short but truly memorable experience

beautiful game absolutely breathtaking for the entire duration the platforming and combat arent super difficult so its fine for pretty much everyone i will say the story did take some deciphering on my part atleast but the great thing about stories is that they make you think super recommended for the art and story a bit pricy for my tastes but on sale i definitely recommend it

absolutely gorgeous game with stunning visuals the story and worldbuilding are so well done and really immerses you into the game everything was tied together so beautifully and i felt very satisfied and fulfilled by the end highly recommend this game its got to be one of my all time favorites

neva is a visually stunning game with a deep and emotional story that leaves a lot open to interpretation compared to its predecessor gris the most notable difference is the introduction of combat mechanics and while usually im not a big fan of acion sequences in narrative games i think neva does a great job at balancing and pacing combat encounters so that they never feel like a distraction from the other aspects of the game
